body.p:
A Union Town Ohio River
June the 22nd 1864
Messrs.
Govor Bramlett
and Major Gen
D. W. Lindsey

I have the honor to Report to you of for The first Tiem Since I let Frankfort I Reached home on the 18th ultimo I found the whole country full of Horse thieves and cut throats I continued my march with a batallion of the 35 Ky.. Mts Inf we left Russellville on the 17th passd through greenvill and madisonville then to Slaughters, will. and dixon to morganfield Mr Reache Moranfield at ten oclock on the morning of the 21st we found about ten guirillars to charged on them and killd three, captured Several horses
We reachd her yesterday Eavening we still Remain here, we have had some skirmishing all day without gaining any advantage I think that we will get them to fight I think that the guirilars members about.400, we have only, 175, men all told &

I wish, general, Lindsey to forward on to Bowlinggreen at Least, 200. twoo hundred guns, of the Ballard, patersn or good carbines with a good Suply of amunition I will take my men and go to Rusells or Bolwinggreen after &
pleas forward these Immediatly Be sure to send the Ballard Rifle for one company and oblige yours

Sebastian. C. Vick
col comd,g, 71.st Regt. E M.
P. S. the guirillars arrested, a, loyal citizen Last night in Morganfield hung him and then Shot, 14, Balls through him they charged him with Being our Spy, he was not our Spy

71
Ky State. Militia
Uniontown. Ohio River
June 22nd 1864
Vick Sebastian C. Col. Comg
71st Rg. E. M. Muhlenburg. Co
Gives an account of his expedition with a Bat of 35th Ky. Mtd. Inft from Russellsville to this place

He reached his home on the 18th May. and found his county full of Guerillars - continued with the 35th to Union town. Wants 200 Ballard guns or Carbines sent to Bowling Green or Russellville - wants the B,llrd rifle for one company at least Wants ordinance stores also. Will take his Reg. to either place for them.

The G,llas arrested hung & shot a Loyal citizen of Morganfield as a spy, but he was not.
over
Rec. I. G. O. June 24 -- 1864

Answered June 27. 1/64
on letter book Page 450=
